content: do not skip this step now attach the cc and begin working the mosaic ugly duckling chart or written stitch pattern two things to remember about mosaic slip_stitch are you knit with only one color at a time for two row in this pattern you alternate between 2 row using cc row 1 & 2 then two row using mc row 3 & 4 and so on each pair of row is identical row 2 is exactly the same as row 1 row 4 is the twin of row 3 row 6 is as like row 5 as peas are in a pod and so on stitch pattern rounds 1-2 cc sl1 k3 around crown decreases rounds 3-4 mc k1 s1 around decreasing happens over the next two repeats of the chart rounds 5-6 cc sl1 k3 around as follows change to dpns as needed rounds 7-8 mc k around first chart repeat row 1 5 as charted beginning with cc repeat the chart or written stitch row 6 sl1 k1 k2 decrease 54 sts pattern until you have completed 6 measured from the row 7 knit around beginning of the slip_stitch pattern and ending with row 8 row 8 k1 k2 decrease 36 sts about 5 chart repeats second chart repeat row 1 5 as charted row 6 sl1 k1 k2 decrease 27 sts row 7 k1 k2 decrease 18 sts row 8 k2 decrease 9 sts finishing cut yarn leaving about 10 and thread it through a tapestry needle thread through all the stitches on the needles and pull up tight weave in all ends wear with brim turned up variations for a worsted weight version using #5 or #6 needles cast on 112 stitches knit 7 before decreasing and proceed as written to change size up or down for any reason yarn needle or head size add or subtract in 8-stitch increments for example up to 80 sts or down to 64 sts so that the decrease instructions work offset the boxes every other chart repeat by beginning with the 3rd stitch from the right on the chart sl1 change the mc after row 7 to begin a set of box frames in another color change cc yarns at each chart repeat or randomly or when scraps run out
